Text: a gang of artists occupies a highly profitable area in the city. Several companies showed interest in buying it.
TextL: support the artists.
TextR: remove the artists and sell it.

Text: researches show that working 35 hours a week doesn't only leave employees with more time for themselves but also increases productivity long term.
TextL: haha, that's half of what I did working in games.
TextR: encourage more companies to introduce it.

Text: the Olympus Games want our country to be the next host! People from all over the world will come to watch!
TextL: I have no time for games.
TextR: you can never have enough stadiums!

Text: we should offer higher taxation benefits for charity donations.
TextL: we can't afford that.

Text: we should build a new phillarmonic hall in the city that will put all others to shame. It will take a year but when its finished the people will love it.
TextL: I'm not sure about your calculations here ...
TextR: yes, the city needs a new landmark.

Text: the bill to legalize same sex marriage is ready for your signature.
TextL: why would I not sign that?

Text: there is a group of people that want to celebrate being GHNish and spread merch with our flag.
TextL: it's okay to be proud but there is no need for another celebration.

Text: legalizing marijuana would decrease small-time criminality and also give us a new source for taxes.
TextL: no, drugs are bad for our people.
TextR: but what about the health of our people?

Text: new studies found out that global warming is in fact real!
TextL: the scientists must be conspirators too.

Text: green Power offered to raise the amount of clean energy to over 90.00 percent, given the right funding.
TextL: other countries don't care about clean energy either.

Text: pollution from traffic keeps increasing in all areas.
TextL: raise a toll on commercial transport.

Text: the big pharma does questionable things with their waste. If we spoil their business they might increase insurance cost for the people though.
TextL: meddling with them isn't worth it.

Text: the Big River flooded several cities again. We need to build a dike and dry it out.
TextL: no, we need to find another way.

Text: the HapPine Forest and Valley should be declared a national park before the industry destroys it.
TextL: we have other forests and valleys in our nation.
TextR: totally, I will make the calls.

Text: we need to rework a system to keep people busy. Let's put the focus on environment.
TextL: what other choice is there?

Text: nuclear power plants have unforseeable consequences for our environment. We should abandon them.
TextL: they will just get power from the nuclear power plants of our neighbours.
TextR: someone has to take the first step in order to save our world.

Text: some companies complain about too high taxes and threaten to relocate their business.
TextL: they're bluffing.

Text: open the borders so the trade can flow more freely.
TextL: we need to focus on ourselves.

Text: companies would be willing to pay more taxes if there was more tolerance in regards of pollution.
TextL: I have little tolerance for that.
TextR: we don't have to be so nitpicky.

Text: our neighbours start to produce and sell wares similar to ours, we expect there are industry spies.
TextL: prosecute theft of IP more thoroughly.
TextR: allow for more surveillance at work.

Text: companies request more building space. There is still a lot of forest left that we can free up.
TextL: I like our forest.

Text: companies are outsourcing their production to poorer countries to save money.
TextL: we can't keep up with these low wage countries.
TextR: offer taxation benefits for lower wage jobs.

Text: we should make it easier for illegal immigrants to come into our country so the industry finds more cheap workers.
TextL: you are fired.

Text: there have been some accidents, some believe it was terrorist attacks.
TextL: no reason to overreact...

Text: people fear about their living standard after the crisis. If there are no raises they will ask us to lower the taxes.
TextL: more of the taxes can be shifted towards the employers
TextR: we can lower the taxes a bit... We still have spare money, right?

Text: we need to rework our health insurance system.
TextL: no we don't.

Text: the introduction of the reformed recycling and waste disposal costs, contrary to our calculation, more than we can afford.
TextL: cut the recycling.
TextR: raise the fee for waste disposal.

Text: another bank files for insolvency. We need to help them out or a lot of people will lose their money.
TextL: we can't afford that.

Text: the Great Celebration of Happiness draws near and our secret service found hints of a potential terrorist attack.
TextL: the celebration can't be canceled anymore. Increase safety measures.

Text: because of a war far away, a lot of refugees flee to our nation.
TextL: set up camps around the border, we will have to be careful.
TextR: our Nation was based on refugees, bid them welcome.

Text: some people want us to build a giant wall to stop illegal immigration.
TextL: why us? Our neighbours should build one.

Text: we spend little money on military, if there is ever a war coming we will be in trouble.
TextL: war. War never changes.
TextR: every penny spend on warfare is a waste.

Text: companies who introduced the 35 hours week register an increased productivity.
TextL: how is that still not a thing?

Text: the phillarmonic hall we are building takes longer than anticipated. We need more funds to continue the construction.
TextL: cancel the project and salvage what's possible.

Text: the phillarmonic hall is done!
TextL: didn't think that day would come.

Text: researches show it is way less damaging than alchohol and does't actually serve as a gateway drug.
TextL: I don't care about facts.
TextR: I don't see the reason we haven't done it yet.

Text: companies request more building space. There is still some forest left that we can free up.
TextL: they have to look somewhere else.
TextR: you can always regrow trees, right?

Text: the clearing of our forests worsened our air. We need to plant more trees to fight this trend.
TextL: I can't notice any difference.

Text: some people from our nation are offended by all the refugees.
TextL: help their integration.
TextR: their unhapiness must come from somthing else.

Text: we could rework the health system again?
TextL: what other options are there?
TextR: yes, people love new health systems.

Text: we could hear out lobbyists so we know how to help our economy?
TextL: what other options are there?

Text: we could schudle a new holiday that is focused on creativity? Maybe?
TextL: what other options are there?
TextR: great idea, people should have more time to be creative.

Text: you are really streching me thin here...
TextL: how about dismissing some officials because our apparatus of state is inefficiently big?
TextR: how about doing something that actually needs work?

Text: the costs to keep lower wage jobs in our country viable are every increasing. The living costs in our country don't allow it.
TextL: keep it up, the next election is close.
TextR: we have to focus on keeping development in our country, not production.
